properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of heat which is considered extreme in this region continues with maximum temperatures exceeding 28 degrees Celsius during the day and overnight minimums remaining at or above 13 degrees Celsius. Temperatures will begin to fall slightly starting Wednesday. ### Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. To get more information: - Check the local news for health and safety updates. - Check HealthLinkBC online resources about heat-related illness and how to protect yourself at www.healthlinkbc.ca/healthlinkbc-files/heat-related-illness. - Call HealthLinkBC at 8-1-1 to ask about heat-related illness. Environment Canada and local Medical Health Officers expect an increase in health and safety risks from heat and are advising the public to take precautions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-06T15:26:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T23:27:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0893885971.2019
Area: Central Coast - inland sections, North Coast - inland including Terrace, North Coast - inland including Kitimat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A thermal ridge will remain over the B.C. interior for the next several days resulting in temperatures reaching 36 degrees Celsius combined with overnight lows near 18 degrees Celsius. This is the first heat event of the season. ### To get more information: - Check the local news for health and safety updates. - Check HealthLinkBC online resources about heat-related illness and how to protect yourself at www.healthlinkbc.ca/healthlinkbc-files/heat-related-illness. - Call HealthLinkBC at 8-1-1 to ask about heat-related illness. Environment Canada and local Medical Health Officers expect an increase in health and safety risks from heat and are advising the public to take precautions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-06T15:25:36-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T23:26:36-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3114761727.2019
Area: Fraser Canyon - north including Lillooet, Fraser Canyon - south including Lytton

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorms associated with an advancing cold continue to move through the region tonight. Some of these thunderstorms may become severe with hail near two centimetres in diameter and wind gusts up to 90 kilometres may continue. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-08-06T06:14:40-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-06T02:08:40-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1250327864.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:14 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is located over Elk Island National Park and is moving southeast at 50 km/h. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-06T04:54:35-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 10:15 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing up to nickel size hail. This line of storms is located 100 km southeast of Moose Factory moving eastward at 40 km/h towards the Quebec border. Communities in the path include: Cesagami Provincial Park ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:55 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking an area of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. There are two severe thunderstorms located 15 km and 30 km northeast of Cochrane moving east at 50 km/h. Both are capable of producing up to toonie sized hail. Commmunities in the path include: Mace, Lowbush River, Eades and Bingle. These thunderstorms will move into Quebec near 10:00 PM EDT this evening. There is also a cluster of severe thunderstorms is located from Eades to Kirkland Lake and is moving southeast at 60 km/h. Communities in the path include: Kirkland Lake, Esker Lakes Provincial Park, Eades, Northlands Park and Kerans. The thunderstorms will move into Quebec near 9:00 PM EDT this evening. Additionally a third storm is located 50 km east of Gogama. Communities in the path include: Matachewan and Elk Lake. ### Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-08-06T03:08:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-06T00:56:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4217010459.2019
Area: Timmins - Cochrane - Iroquois Falls, Kirkland Lake - Englehart
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 35 knots and frequent lightning. The squalls will be associated with thunderstorms moving eastward over the regions early this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Boaters may be surprised by strong gusts over bodies of water. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-06T05:59:57-00:00
